revised_title: Protein Phosphorylation and Hormone Action: A Review
tldr: This lecture reviews the role of protein phosphorylation in hormone action, focusing on how extracellular signals coordinate biochemical functions through the activation of protein kinases and phosphatases. The author discusses the mechanisms involved in hormone signaling, the role of second messengers, and the impact of protein phosphorylation on cellular processes.
